title: InstallingSSLCertificate
description:
Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice. This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 2009 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved.


1. Copy SSL private key into /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.key/ssp.key file. The key should be without a password.

2. Copy SSL certificate into /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.crt/ssp.crt file.

3. Make sure both files owned by user root and have 600 as their permissions: 


root# chown root:wheel /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.key/ssp.key
root# chown root:wheel /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.crt/ssp.crt
root# chmod 600 /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.key/ssp.key
root# chmod 600 /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.crt/ssp.crt


4 Restart Apache web server:


root# /usr/local/etc/rc.d/apache* restart

 1. Copy SSL private key into /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.key/ssp.key file. The key should be without a password.  
 2. Copy SSL certificate into /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.crt/ssp.crt file.  
 3. Make sure both files owned by user root and have 600 as their permissions:   
   
  root# chown root:wheel /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.key/ssp.key
root# chown root:wheel /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.crt/ssp.crt
root# chmod 600 /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.key/ssp.key
root# chmod 600 /usr/local/etc/apache/ssl.crt/ssp.crt  
   
 4 Restart Apache web server: 
   
  root# /usr/local/etc/rc.d/apache* restart
